headline: The Top 5 Analyst Questions From ServiceNow’s Q4 Earnings Call
summary: ServiceNow’s fourth quarter results surpassed Wall Street’s revenue and non-GAAP profit expectations, but the market reaction was notably negative. Management focused on the acceleration in AI-driven product uptake and major enterprise wins, citing strong adoption of Now Assist and workflow automation across industries. CEO Bill McDermott described the period as ServiceNow's “largest quarter in history” for CRM net new annual contract value, emphasizing customer demand for end-to-end AI and work

Management focused on the acceleration in AI-driven product uptake and major enterprise wins, citing strong adoption of Now Assist and workflow automation across industries. CEO Bill McDermott described the period as ServiceNow's “largest quarter in history” for CRM net new annual contract value, emphasizing customer demand for end-to-end AI and work

content.title: Why the AI driven software stock crash probably isn't over

headline: Nvidia's Huang Says It's 'Illogical' to Think AI Will Replace Software Tools
summary: Worries about artificial intelligence disrupting the software business are overblown, Nvidia Chief Executive Jensen Huang said.  "There's this notion that the software industry is in decline and will be replaced by AI," Huang said late Tuesday at an event hosted by Cisco, hours after a selloff in U.S. software stocks.  "There's a whole bunch of software companies whose stock prices are under a lot of pressure because somehow AI is going to replace them," Huang said.

content.title: Nvidia's Huang Says It's 'Illogical' to Think AI Will Replace Software Tools

"There's a whole bunch of software companies whose stock prices are under a lot of pressure because somehow AI is going to replace them," Huang said.

headline: Software stocks take hit on AI. Is Wall Street worried of a bubble?
summary: A sell-off storm brewed over software stocks in Tuesday's session over growing AI concerns tied to Anthropic's (ANTH.PVT) new AI chatbot Claude. Lossdog Founder and CEO Tom Sosnoff and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma break down Wall Street's latest reaction to software companies, top firms' coverage on software stocks, and investor speculation about a bubble forming in the software sector. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: MeasureUp Launches MeasureUp Alliance, a New End-to-End Program to Scale Certification Readiness with Exam Integrity First
summary: MeasureUp today announced the launch of MeasureUp Alliance, a new program designed for technology vendors and certification owners who want to scale candidate outcomes, partner enablement, and product adoption without adding operational burden or compromising exam credibility.
